org.apache.ambari.server

Class KdcServerConnectionVerification

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.ambari.server.KdcServerConnectionVerification

  • public class KdcServerConnectionVerification
extends Object
    Utility class which checks connection to Kerberos Server.

    It has two potential clients.

    • Ambari Agent: Uses it to make sure host can talk to specified KDC Server

    • Ambari Server: Uses it for connection check, like agent, and also validates the credentials provided on Server side.

    • Method Detail

      • isKdcReachable

        public boolean isKdcReachable(String kdcHost)
        Given server IP or hostname, checks if server is reachable i.e. we can make a socket connection to it. Hostname may contain port number separated by a colon.
        Parameters:
        kdcHost - KDC server IP or hostname (with optional port number)
        Returns:
        true, if server is accepting connection given port; false otherwise.

      • isKdcReachable

        public boolean isKdcReachable(String server,
                              int port)
        Given a host and port, checks if server is reachable meaning that we can communicate with it. First we attempt to connect via TCP and if that is unsuccessful, attempt via UDP. It is important to understand that we are not validating credentials, only attempting to communicate with server process for the give host and port.
        Parameters:
        server - KDC server IP or hostname
        port - KDC port
        Returns:
        true, if server is accepting connection given port; false otherwise.

      • isKdcReachable

        public boolean isKdcReachable(String server,
                              int port,
                              KdcServerConnectionVerification.ConnectionProtocol connectionProtocol)
        Attempt to communicate with KDC server over a specified communication protocol (TCP or UDP).
        Parameters:
        server - KDC hostname or IP address
        port - KDC server port
        connectionProtocol - the type of connection to use
        Returns:
        true if communication is successful; false otherwise

      • getKdcConnection

        protected org.apache.directory.kerberos.client.KdcConnection getKdcConnection(org.apache.directory.kerberos.client.KdcConfig config)
        Get a KDC UDP connection for the given configuration. This has been extracted into it's own method primarily for unit testing purposes.
        Parameters:
        config - KDC connection configuration
        Returns:
        new KDC connection

      • setConnectionTimeout

        public void setConnectionTimeout(int timeoutSeconds)
        Set the connection timeout. This is the amount of time that we will attempt to read data from connection.
        Parameters:
        timeoutSeconds - timeout in seconds

      • getConnectionTimeout

        public int getConnectionTimeout()
        Get the timeout value.
        Returns:
        the connection timeout value in seconds

      • parsePort

        protected int parsePort(String port)
        Parses port number from given string.
        Parameters:
        port - port number string
        Returns:
        parsed port number
        Throws:
        NumberFormatException - if given string cannot be parsed
        IllegalArgumentException - if given string is null or empty
